oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grace Episcopal Church: northwest view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eatherly, Brad, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of a white board and batten church viewed from the northwest. The bellows of the pipe organ are held inside the gabled section to the right of the brick chimney. The altar is located inside the gabled section at the rear of the building. The belfry with a cross affixed to the top is in the foreground of the photo.

Grace Episcopal Church was established in 1877 with the completion of the church building. It was constructed by P.J. Williamson in the Carpenter Gothic style along Main Street in Spring Hill at a cost of $1800.00, funded by members of the church and friends from the community.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Church buildings
Episcopal churches
